course_title: Special Laboratory Topics in Chemistry: Experimental Phys.Chemistry
class_notes:
Chem 371LW has two broad objectives.  The first is to explore topics and techniques in physical chemistry via data analysis and problem solving.  The second is to prepare students to effectively communicate scientific results via writing.  Lab exercises will span various areas of experimental physical chemistry including kinetics, thermodynamics, and spectroscopy.  Additionally, students will become familiar with some of the data manipulation and visualization tools used in the chemical sciences.  This is a writing-intensive course and students will produce scientific reports and become familiar with the American Chemical Society (ACS) journal article publication process.  Specific emphasis will be placed on the peer-review process and journal article formatting.


(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)
course_description: A laboratory course for advanced students on topics of current interest in chemistry.
prerequisites: CHEM 300L or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
